choices: agree to untie him if he unties you
ignore him, you're not even supposed to be here.
pretend you dont understand the language.
tell him, "No, better not risk it."
let him untie you, then ignore him.
1.content:
You were traveling in Mexico when the hotel you were staying at was overrun by some sort of terrorist group. They came in to the hotel lobby where you were waiting for an elevator and kidnapped a small group of international politicians. There was gunfire and the power went out and everyone was running around screaming.

In all the confusion, you are hit in the head from behind. When you wake up, you are in the back of a van with your hands tied behind you. There are others in the van with you. Some are unconscious and all have their hands tied. One of the prisoners offers to untie you if you help untie him.

What will you do?
1.title: Terrorists

choices: answer it.
tell the guard to answer it.
keep quiet.
knock the phone off the table.
start trying to loosen your bonds.
11.content:
So you agree to untie him, and he unties you in return. When the van stops, your captors open the back and discover you are untied and beat you both with a stick for trying to escape, and your hands are tied again.

They lead all of you out of the van and into a building. You and the other one that tried to escape are seperated from the rest of the prisoners and taken to an interrogation room. Bleeding and bruised you are roughly seated in chairs at a table with a telephone. A guard is assigned and you are told to wait for the interrogator. The phone rings loudly.

What will you do?
11.title: Interrogation Room

choices: Try to kick the door down.
Search for stuff on the desk.
111.content: You answer the phone and the guard says, "WHAT ARE YOU DOING?????? THAT IS MYYYY PHOONEE!!!! YOU BAD....." The guy knocks you out and the next thing you notice is that you are in a small, closed, locked room. You notice a desk full of papers, wood, soda, and a few other things.
111.title: Locked up

choices: try to escape-he's on the other side of the room.
or should you stay put, he may be pretending.
113.content:
You ignore the phone ringing, but the guy who untied you didn't. "Sir, the phone is ringing," he said.

Then you both make an amazing discovery. The man's back was turned when the guy said "The phone's ringing," but your guard didn't even glance at the phone,

The other captive looks at you and smiles, "He's deaf!" he yells loudly. You glance up at the man who is guarding you and swallow hard. Should you--
113.title: An Amazing Discovery

1131.content:
YOu slowly stand up and start inching toward the door. The guy yells again, "That's the way! I'm coming!"

All of a sudden the guard turns around quickly. He grins wickedly as he pulls the trigger.

Your dead. Made the wrong choice. Start over.
1131.title: Bang!  Your Dead.

choices: Your significant other, tied in bonds as well
One classy-lookin' woman
1132.content:
"Gimme a break," you say to the other prisoner. "If you wanted to know what we were thinking, or what we were talking about, wouldn't you pretend you couldn't hear us? Man, I thought of that in the van when I was deciding whether or not to pretend not to understand you. What a classic move."

The other prisoner looks at you, one eye swollen shut, but the other glimmering with irritation. "Dammit, I think the son of a whore is deaf *and* pretty damn dumb."

The guard turns back to face you, a smirk on his face. In gutteral English, he mutters, "My momma no whore. She high-price call girl. Onlee the best!" And he has the audacity to grin.

He makes a face at you, and you want to get up and hit his smirk from one end of the room to the other. Just as you're contemplating how far it is from him to you, the door opens, and in walks . . .
1132.title: Pretty Damn Dumb

choices: The liquid was poison.
The liquid was truth-serum.
11322.content:
A woman dressed very formally walks in, carrying a purse. You try to see what's inside the woman's purse, but your vision is blurred when the guard comes over and hits you on the back of the head. You fall unconscience on the floor.

         When you wake up, you find yourself on the same room, but now on a table. The guard is still standing there over you.

         "One of the prisoners are awake!" the guard yells.

         The woman you saw before walks in again, but looking less classy. She goes over and takes a needle our of her purse. She gives you a dose of some liquid. Immediately you feel the effects. Your vision is blurred again and you can't concentrate.
11322.title: The Woman with the Needle

choices: eat the glop
lay down on the straw and try to sleep.
114.content:
Your head is already pounding from the previous beatings you endured, and a ringing phone is doing nothing to soothe it. Annoyed and irritated, you stand up and kick the phone off the table. It jangles and clatters loudly across the floor, coming to rest at the feet of the guard, who picks it up. He smiles at your fierceness and backhands you across the face with the phone. You see blackness invading your vision as you slowly lose consciousness.

You wake up in almost complete darkness with a gnawing hunger in your stomach and an open wound on your face, throbbing and bleeding. You survey your surroundings and determine that you are in a 5 by 5 cell with a pile of straw and a bucket of horrible smelling glop.

Now what do you do?
114.title: Isolation

choices: play possum
jump up and yell something
1141.content:
You haven't eaten is as long as you can remember, so in spite of its vile odor you scoop handfuls of glop from the bucket and devour it hungrily. It stinks and it tastes foul but at least it is filling the void.

Afterward, you rest for a bit on the pile of straw. While you are laying there you see a tiny window far above you high on the wall. A dim light filters through the muddy glass and shines on you. The light plays across your face and dances away across the wall. You think, who's there? Are they trying to see if I'm still alive?

You decide to.......
1141.title: Down Time

choices: surprise the gaurd and take his weapon
let him pull you out of the hole first, then jump him.
11411.content:
You decide to lay there and play dead. If your captors think you are dead they may try to come and remove your body, you reason. So you lay motionless, trying not to breath, waiting...Soon, after a long silence, you sneak a peak and see the window opening with a creak and a man starts climbing down a rope toward you. When he gets to the bottom you hear his boots hit the ground and he walks over to you. He kicks you hard in the side to roust you in case you are just sleeping. You hold in the yelp that came to your lips and force yourself to remain limp and motionless. The gaurd pokes at you with his rifle and convinced that you are dead he shouts up to the outside gaurd,

" Throw down the other rope and go tell the commander that he's dead. I'm bringing him up!"

You hear a coil of rope hit the ground by your head and the gaurd roughly begins to secure you to it. You know that you are now alone with one armed gaurd. You figure you have one chance left to escape. You can either.....
11411.title: One Chance Left

choices: Tell them the truth hoping they'll let you go.
Make up a lie, hoping they'll let you go. It better be a good one.
keep quiet.
head butt the nearest captor and run for your life.
12.content:
You hear him talking to you but you are angry that you are being held prisoner in the first place, so you ignore him, wanting to be left alone. He persists and soon he's in your face, antagonizing you. All the attention focused on you now, the other prisoners start to see that you are not an international politician like they are and they begin to get suspicious of you.

When the van stops, and your captors open the back the other prisoners begin pointing at you whispering to the captors on their way out. You are eventually pulled aside by one of the captors and asked for your name.

What will you say?
12.title: Name Please?

choices: listen and soak it all in.....
turn a deaf ear ......
121.content:
"My name is Richard Louis Bryant, I am an American on vacation. At least I was on vacation until you guys detained me. You have my identification and my passport in my billfold. That should prove what I am telling you. Can you tell me why I am being held captive?"

"QUIET!!" screams the guard. " Why are you plotting against our movement?"

"What plotting? I don't even know who you are...", you plead. The guard narrows his eyes at you and tells you..

" You will talk sometime... American." and he spits on the ground by your feet. He begins to tell you about their movement to overthrow the Mexican government and bring prosperity to Mexico. You don't care about their movement in the slightest. Do you.....
121.title: The Movement

choices: sit down and think
start walking
123.content:
Instead of answering, you say nothing, glaring at spot two inches in front of your toes. The ground is rich black humus with hard black pebbles scattered through it. As your captors argue amongst themselves in Spanish, you wonder if the pebbles are volcanic in origin.

Without warning, the other passengers are loaded back into the van. To your surprise, a thin man in loose-fitting clothes grabs your shoulders and spins you around to face the surrounding jungle. In the brief glimpse you get of his face, you notice his eye lashes are extraordinarily long, giving him a slightly feminine appearance.

Anticipating a shot in the back of your head, you close your eyes tightly and tense up your shoulders. Your hands are cut free, but before you can react, someone kicks you hard right on your tailbone sending you tumbling into a thick stalked, large-leafed shrub that might be an Elephant Ears, or might be something you've never heard of before. As you struggle back to your feet the van drives off, leaving you alone in the middle of a Mexican jungle.
123.title: Alone in the dark

choices: Flashback down memory lane
Pick a direction and start walking
1231.content:
Shock, relief, and a sudden fear of never finding your way out, all slam together inside your mind, weakening your knees. Sitting helps, but now you have nothing to do but contemplate your situation.

You know you are surrounding by deep green rain forest. Tall trees with sprawling roots, wide-leafed shrubs, and tiny flowers on vines winding their way up tree trunks are not found in deserts or even temperate woodlands. Assuming you are still in Mexico, the presence of a rain forest also means you are as far from the border as it is possible to get. You might be near the east coast, or you might be near the southern border, but you are definitely a long way from Texas, New Mexico and Arizona.

This was not the way you expected this trip to unfold.
1231.title: Jungle

124.content:
The man in front of you takes another step forward, nose to nose with you. He shouts his question in Spanish: "Llamo! Llamo!" Name! Name! You look at him, he looks pretty pissed. But he's not a very big guy. Glancing around, you notice the other gun-toting Mexicans are busy herding the politicians into a broken-down building, and aren't paying much attention to you and The Screamer.

You act before you really think. Slamming your head forward in a classical soccer move, you break The Screamer's nose, and he (big surprise) scream in pain as blood gushes down his face. But you don't stand around to watch. You take off down the road, zig-zagging back and forth as your eyes wildly sweep the area for cover.

But alas, it was not to be. Just when you feel your lungs ready to burst, you hear the sharp staccato of a machine gun behind you. You glance up, into the clear blue sky, and have time for one simple thought -- *why*? You never feel yourself hit the ground.

Suggest you might wanna go back and re-think that headbutting decision, partner.
124.title: Butt Out!

choices: Kick out the window and run like hell
Keep the window in mind, but forget about it for now
Recruit your Mexican-speaking friend to help you out
13.content:
The other prisoner repeats his request -- he'll untie you if you untie him. You stare at him, trying to think through the wave of pain beating through your head. What to do? You quickly take stock of your situation -- a whole bunch of people stuck in a van. All of them except you are Mexican. It's probably a good idea if you keep your cards close to your chest and pretend you don't understand the language.

The man looks at you, repeating his request a third time, in a louder voice. As if you're going to understand him if he yells at you. The man driving the truck turns his head, yelling at both of you to settle down and be quiet, or you'll regret it.

You lay your head back down on the floor, facing a side window. It's darkly tinted, hard to see out of, and even harder to see into. You watch the streets fly by, block after block, and they all seem the same to you. Why didn't you take that tour bus like your aunt suggested, instead of going it alone in Mexico?

As your thoughts roam, you notice something about the window. The caulking around the outside edges are cracked. The glass rattles in the frame, as if a good kick would smash the glass, leaving the window frame empty. Could you bust the window with your feet, then wiggle through before the guy driving the truck has a chance to stop? And how well could you run with bound hands?
13.title: Pondering Escape

131.content:
Against your better judgement, you wait for the van to slow down and then you position yourself for a good strong kick at the window. The caulking is as weak as you suspected and immediately gives way when you kick the window out. Glass flies out into the street and you start to crawl through as best as you can. You are about halfway out when the driver notices you hanging out the window. Instead of slowing down he speeds up and you go flying out of the van as he rounds a corner at high speed.

Unfortunately, your skull was not made to be bashed against an asphalt road at high speeds. You are dead.

Sorry, but that was a particularly bad choice . If you want to try again,start the story over or go back to the previous chapter.
131.title: Road Pizza

132.content: U shoulda done it when u had the chance. U hear over da radio "OK, if you won't submit i'll kill A HOSTAGE!" He leans back and shoots you. Your in hell now. Hell sucks. HAHA. unless u blow nads. what the fuck.
132.title: moron.

choices: Yes. You might need it later.
No. You might get caught!
14.content:
You decide to tell him " No, better not risk it." He looks at you like your crazy and teams up with someone else to try to escape.

When the van stops, your captors open up the back of the van and discover the two untied prisoners. They are beaten severely with a stick and seperated from the rest of you. You pat yourself on the back for not going along with them. You'll remember their screams of pain for a long time to come. The rest of you are lead into a building and told to wait in a large holding cell. A guard closes and locks the door behind him with a gold key. You notice that a silver key falls off the ring when he puts them back in his pocket. It comes to rest on the floor, just inches on the other side of the cell door. You look around at the other prisoners. Noone else seems to have noticed the key. The guard turns his back. Do you try to pick up the key?
14.title: Holding Cell

choices: Yes, I did
I don't know what you mean
141.content:
You reach for the key, trying hard not to make sudden noises or even breathe. Your fingers inch closer to the key, closer.....
You grab it, and immediately hide it away in your palm. The guard was busy checking one of the other prisoners, and did not even notice you. You hide the key as inconspicuously as possible as they lead you away......
Suddenly one of the prisoners near you whispers in your ear
"Did you grab the key?"
You answer:
141.title: Taking the Key

choices: "There's no way you're getting my key. Every man for himself!"
"I'm only gonna lend my key to an escape attempt if you tell me what the
1411.content:
Figuring the prisoner must have watched you pocket the key, you nod slightly, eyes straight ahead.

Out of the corner of your mouth, you mutter, "Do you know what it's for?"

The other prisoner, a man in his late 40s, leans close to you and whispers, "We're in the holding cells of an old jail outside of town. The government stopped using it a long time ago because it's such a horrible place -- they used to torture people here back in the '50s! I toured this place once, and there aren't many locked doors, except for the ones that lead to the outside."

The guard turns around and stares at the two of you. Did he overhear the whispered conversation? It appears not, he's turning back around, reading a 1970s Playboy at his desk.

"So anyway," the man continues, "if we can get out of this cell, that key in your pocket might lead to a door that gets us the hell out of here!"

Having seen the prisoners beaten inside the van for trying to escape, you're not too keen on the idea. But this guy could prove useful to you. So you say,
1411.title: Decisions, Decisions

choices: Tell the truth this time.
Try another lie.
1412.content:
You look at him and say, " I don't know what you mean. The key? "

He stares blankly at you for a half a second then whispers, " It was right there. It fell off the guard's key ring. Didn't you pick it up? Didn't you see it?"

You try to run the situation through your brain quickly. Think of something! Quick!

"Yeah I saw it. I was hoping to get it but the guard picked it back up again," you say,lying through your teeth."Didn't you see him?"

"No." he says, scanning your face for the truth. "Are you sure? I never saw him come back..."

"Well, " you say, " I was sitting right here, and he came back and looked at me funny, then picked it up and walked off."

"He's lying." comes another voice from the back of the cell. " I saw him pick it up."

" I did not!" you say, as panic grips you. " The guard picked it up!"

The others in the cell sit up and take notice of this little confrontation. You continue insisting that you didn't pick up the key, but the prisoner who called you out insists that he saw you take it. Soon, the argument gets rather loud and the guard comes back. The other prisoners squeal on you and the guard beats the key out of you.

You realize you better start forming alliances with the other prisoners if you want to make it out of here. You are left on the floor of the cell bleeding, and a few of the other prisoners come over and attend to you.

" You are the only one we can't figure out." says one of them. " There is a reason that each of us has been taken, as we are all influential political figures from around the world. But you? Who are you? Why have you been taken?"

Tell the truth? Or lie again?
1412.title: A Beating

choices: answer it.
tell the gaurd to answer it.
do nothing, you're in enough trouble as it is.
knock the phone off the table.
work at loosening your bonds under the table.
15.content:
You agree and he unties you. He is quite upset when you do not untie him in return, and he starts protesting loudly. When the van stops, your captors open the back and discover you are untied and beat you with a stick for trying to escape, and your hands are tied again.

They lead all of you out of the van and into a building. You are seperated from the rest of the prisoners and taken to an interrogation room. Bleeding and bruised you are roughly seated in a chair at a table with a telephone. A guard is assigned and you are told to wait for the interrogator. The phone rings loudly.
15.title: Interrogation Room

choices: Tell him the truth
Make up a lie. It better be a good one.
151.content:
Your hands are tied, but you can still get the phone off the hook and put it to your ear. You begin pleading with the caller.

" Whoever this is I demand to be let out of here! This is a big mistake! I don't know why you people abducted me, but I don't belong here. I was only on vaca......."

The guard stops your chatter with a jab in the face from his rifle butt. Your nose immediately starts flowing with blood and you choke on the musty, acrid smell in your sinuses and lay your head on the table.

The guard takes the phone from you and talks breifly into the receiver, then drops it back in the cradle.

" The commander will be here in a few minutes. I suggest you behave yourself until then. He wants to talk to you..."

When the door opens you lift your head from the pool of blood on the table and look up.The commander enters the room and sits opposite you at the table.

" What is your name?" he asks you.

Do you tell him or lie to him?
151.title: The Commander

choices: You score a touchdown BY YOURSELF
The world ends.
152.content: That little fucknut tells you to fuck off and burn in hell. He'll answer whatever the hell he pleases. So he answers it. It's the president. The president tells him to suck his dick in exchange for the ransom. Terrorist says fuck no and shoots you in the arms, ears, eyes and nose. You are hurt and unusable, so they begin playing football with your limbless body.
152.title: YOU FUCKING MORON!  DON'T DO THAT!

choices: Go to Hell
Go to a mystery place beginning with "H" and ending with "ell"
1521.content: OH NO! The opposing team gets pissed and fires a bullet at your crotch. Quickly, thinking of the shit u learned @ www.yzworld.com u decide to just sit there and die. It's not much fun being a limbless blind and deaf body, is it?
1521.title: YOU LOSE, FUCKHEAD!!!!!!

choices: learn the YZway by being around YZkids?
Fuck the system over.
1522.content: ...Except the YZkids don't. At www.yzworld.com everyone is happy! So happy it isn't even funny. As you are just a pitiful human, you die. Of course, with their amazing technology of Conning, the con God into letting all the fuckheads who died return to life, but as better YZpeople. But one person returns, without learning of the YZway of life. Do they...
1522.title: YZworld.com kicks ass.

choices: YZpunkz (wild and crazy)
YZdruids (peaceful and stoned)
15221.content: Yes, you got it right. That's what happens. But the real question is... do they choose to be docile and euphoric or do they choose to live as YZpunkz??? We must way the advantages of each. Being docile means everything's good. It's like your high all the time. High on LSD. You're just like, yeah man...that's cool. It's very rare you'll get a ton of stuff done like this (although you still get done more than NORMAL people)...YZpunkz have a higher likelihood of screwing up. For example, they might accidentally steal somebody's truck without realizing that was mean and it hurt them. Since the guy who owns the truck is YZ he realizes that its everyones truck..we're all one... but still its mean to steal it. GEt it? What happens, man?
15221.title: whoodooze

15222.content: YOUR A DUMBASS! thats impossible. Since there's only one, they can't fuck the system because of the FIRST YZvirtue... never be unhappy. So if he decides to smash everything you own, it's ok. They're only material posessions anyway. Its utterly impossible. YOU LOSE, JACKASS
15222.title: YOU MOTHERFUCKER!!! YOU LOST

choices: Don't argue... walk
Ask him why and refuse to move
155.content:
Your sore fingers begin to work at the knot around your wrists. You look around quickly from the gaurd to your fellow captives, hoping that no one will notice you busily loosening your shackles.

You work at the rope for at least 15 minutes, and tears of dispair begin to fill your eyes when you realize you aren't making any progress. You think about all your family and friends and wonder if you will ever see them again.

Another gaurd has walked in the room and is talking to his collegue in a language you can't understand. One of them points to you and you freeze. The other people in the room look at you with pity and you wonder what is going on.

"What's happening?" You ask, trying to keep the fear from your voice.

But before anyone can answer you are swept off of your chair and onto your feet.

"Move!" The gaurd barks at you with a thick accent.
155.title: Move!

info.description:
This story is still under construction. If you dont want to ruin the surprise for yourself, go no farther. If you are not one of the five authors who developed this project, please don't add any chapters. They'll just be deleted anyway. Love ya', ZooDuck

6/27/01 Some time has passed since this was started. I've left the above part just as it was when it was originally written. It's still an idea that sometimes works itself to the surface again with a new twist, or something to think about. But this is also one of the ones that is almost at a stall...

You guys know what it's like to try to continue a long-dead project; to try to rehash the whole thing in your mind, looking for things like clarity, worthiness, etc. Does it still make sense to you?

If you get past that first part, then you have to go through the whole process of immersing yourself all over again in the original idea. The thing that made you excited to embark on the whole project in the first place. I'm not quite there with this one yet. But it's still an idea.

It's a very time consuming thing, no doubt about it. ZD
